metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9269 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In libzypp before August 2018 GPG keys attached to YUM repositories were not correctly pinned, allowing malicious repository mirrors to silently downgrade to unsigned repositories with potential malicious content.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9269` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzypp-bin - 17.6.1-1
libzypp-common - 17.6.1-1
libzypp-config - 17.6.1-1
libzypp1722 - 17.6.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libzypp package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '17.6.1-1').
